text: Emma Haché is a Canadian writer of Acadian descent. She was born in Lamèque, New Brunswick on November 25, 1979, and studied theatre at the Université de Moncton. She moved to Montreal and continued her studies there at , at the École de Mime Corporel and the Centre de création scénique. Her first play Lave tes mains (2002) received the Prix littéraire Antonine-Maillet-Acadie Vie (youth category). She received the Prix Gratien-Gélinas in 2003 for L'intimité, which was also awarded the Governor General's Award for French- language drama. Her play Trafiquée was a finalist for a Governor General's Award in 2010 and received the Prix littéraire Antonine-Maillet-Acadie-Vie. == References == Category:Living people Category:Canadian dramatists and playwrights in French Category:Governor General's Award-winning dramatists Category:Acadian people Category:1979 births Category:Canadian women dramatists and playwrights Category:21st-century Canadian dramatists and playwrights Category:21st-century Canadian women writers Category:People from Gloucester County, New Brunswick Category:Writers from New Brunswick Category:Université de Moncton alumni
title: Emma Haché
